Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in September?? where are you ladies Methusala StillKicking

Posts.Content: Mar 23, 2008 02:03PM - edited Mar 23, 2008 02:16PM by joykeeperorg Sorry you are having a tuff time right now here is what I decided on:  I went with a lumpectomy first  (Aug 10 07) because my doctor didnt really give me a choice his whole reason was i was to young an didnt need to worry dx at 23, and my left breast was a lil more perky an smaller than my right. In Jan I had a bi lat mast. My reasons for this was my family history 4 women have had bc an passed away from it. I had to give my self a lil more peace of mind! I would worry about it "coming back" in the other breast so I said you know what just take them both an when im done with rads I will get reconstruction an I get to pick which size I want! I had a bi lat mast on 23 Jan 08 I had more pain to me wit my lumpec than my mast. My doctors thought it would be better for me to have rads as well.....  You can always get a second opinion or do some research on lumpect vs mast. this site has help a lot with information on that. Just remember do whats best for you an not what the surgeons think!
Posts.Title: lumpectomy regrets haykat57 Merle

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2007 12:48PM joykeeperorg wrote: Hi ladies I started chemo Sept 2 of this year im on a dose dense of 4 AC and 4 T. I just had my first taxol and of course I had the neulasta shot after words. The pain was horrible I ended up going to the ER on Sunday my fever was 100.3 and I felt like I was getting shocked all over my body.  They did blood work and I had 60,000 white blood cells they said that a "normal" person has anywhere between 4 to 10,000. Has anyone else had this problem? When do you know to go to the ER for a fever? Is there a cutoff point?

Posts.Content: May 14, 2008 08:45AM - edited May 14, 2008 08:52AM by joykeeperorg O hun Im sorry you are so scared right now. I was 23 when I was diagnosed. I have a huge famiy history of bc. In no way am I trying to scare you so I hope you dont take it that way. The area where my lump was sore to. Im glad that they arent just sitting on it an letting it go to see if it goes away. Try to keep good spirits an dont freak yourself out to much. Jus because of your past family history doesnt mean that you have it!  I hope everything works out for you! We are all here to help you with any questions you have!
